Evidence of unauthorized financial trans.Data: Zeek conn.log, Zeek http.log, Windows Event ID 4624, Windows Event ID 4663
Evidence of unauthorized financial trans.Action: Monitor Zeek conn.log and http.log for connections to financial services or systems from unusual internal or external sources. Analyze Windows Event IDs 4624 (successful logon) and 4663 (attempted access to objects) on financial servers for suspicious login times or access patterns. Use correlation analysis to link successful logins or data access attempts with unusual network connections. Flag connections/access deviating significantly from established baselines (e.g., using time series analysis or anomaly detection on connection volume/frequency).

Suspicious network traffic or activity r.Data: Zeek conn.log, Zeek http.log, Zeek dns.log
Suspicious network traffic or activity r.Action: Monitor Zeek conn.log, http.log, and dns.log for connections to known malicious IPs, domains, or patterns associated with ransomware C2 infrastructure or data leak sites, as identified by threat intelligence. Analyze the volume and frequency of connections to suspicious external sites. Use entropy measures or correlation analysis to identify data transfer patterns indicative of exfiltration.
